channel.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
channel.description: Hey. Considering it's been out of stock for months without any ETAs on the stock, I was wondering if maybe someone had an unused core they'd like to part with? I'm UK-based just in case. Cheers!

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @weasel79 blender
item.description:
@weasel79 wrote:

Yeah stock is updated frequently and according to what andrew about the total abount of this batch, said they should go in/out of stock regularly over the next couple weeks. No need to panic just yet..

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Indeed. Boards are tested by hand when they arrive from the factory to make sure you get a good product, and that process takes some time.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cedrick wrote:

I feel lucky that I had only to wait for 3 weeks only between the time I posted here to know if my project could be easily realized with the board, Andrew's answer and infos, then this new stock made available Great great great!

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?

@Zeak wrote:

The stock is back! Ordered mine already. Thanks to everyone for moral (and not only) support in this thread, it's an awesome community here by the looks of it

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @s8jfou
item.description:
@s8jfou wrote:

I will support you like I support Johannes, I like what you wanna do, probably if nobody like you existed, every project ever made will be stuck into his basic state. And it's bad.
I'm not blaming you. Don't take it personnaly.
But I think we saw your project, we are beside you with respect, exactly as we are beside johannes.

What I just wanted to say, again with respect, is that you don't need to say to people still want the original core, that you are building a boosted version and they have to wait or don't forget it. Your thread is all day on the top of this forum. we all saw it. Don't be afraid you'll get support

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

I have nothing but respect and admiration for what Johannes has done. I understand the desire to support him. But at a certain point the community needs to move forward. We can't just wait for a single person to take care of everything for us. It's clear that development has stalled. I think we can do better. All I'm trying to do is move the technology forward to the next level, not take credit for what has been done so far. If what's been done so far suits your needs, that's great! I think we can have an ecosystem of compatible DSP boards, more like how there are many Arduino-compatible boards of different levels of performance, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @s8jfou
item.description:
@s8jfou wrote:

urklang my friend, I'm looking every day at you thread to understand exactly what your plan is.

Keep in mind the original design actually is perfect for most of us, because even if you can do a stronger engine than the original one, the possibility of the axoloti core is still so deep, with still so much possibility, so much thing to do with it.

I agree with many things already told in your thread especially about sample things. I will probably test your version because it's an interesting things.

But to be honest, I have so many things to do with the original project. Johannes oppenned many doors, you probably want to have an automatic door or an elevator something like that, but for me, the original axoloti core is exactly the perfect thing that I've always dream about. Because of this I want to support Johannes. He did an open source project, so he probably know that what you do will happened. Even probably he will be happy. But he is working on an axoloti core 2.0 and we all know it. I don't need a boosted version of the axoloti for my project, I want to support him so I will buy his original version.

Don't forget the fact that if you can do what you plan to, is thanks to him. So, don't be afraid, we are looking for yours version too. You don't have to go in the other thread to advertise about your plan and make publicity about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Really the only things missing are full MIDI DIN and 1/4th jacks. Both are easily added if you need them. The old core DIN and power section is directly compatible as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Vast improvement, maybe, unless you wanted the things missing from your new shrunk/simplified version.

This is an interesting time.

Regarding Johannes’ new production run...
I think if I was building a run of 500, or even 200, I’d be using the H7, even if the design remains unchanged otherwise. I’d certainly have done some work to see how easily H7 drops in.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Keep in mind that my new design will be a vast improvement over the existing core: 4x sdram and processing power among other improvements for the same price (https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/next-gen-and-mini-axoloti-hardware-discussion/5908/102).

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @AndrewChi
item.description:
@AndrewChi wrote:

Haha, I would love to see a couple billion too! But I think it's 500 or something like that.
There were a lot of boxes and the production run was fine.
It was pretty exciting to see so many Core's together.
So will be any day now!!!

item.title: Anyone selling their unused core?
item.dc:creator: @s8jfou
item.description:
@s8jfou wrote:

haha nice, but less than 200 ?
I don't have any idea about the "supply & demand", but I have the idea that in 1 day 200 units can be sold easily... maybe I'm wrong. This summer was a loooong wait for the next batch, I've watched the stock every day. I'm afraid about loosing my turn in one hour and have to wait again 3 months.

I was secretly asking this with the hope that you'll answer me "more than 2 billion of brand new axolotis my friend !"

Read full topic

pretty sure it's gonna be way more than 20!!!
